Package library.io

Class Sound

java.lang.Object
library.io.Sound
public class Sound extends Object
Class for playing Java supported audio files such as .wav, .aiff, and .au

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Sound(File file)
    Loads a file for playing audio

    Loads file for playing audio

  • Constructor Details

    • Sound

      public Sound(String filepath) throws UnsupportedAudioFileException, IOException, LineUnavailableException
      Loads file for playing audio
      Parameters:
      filepath - the string path of the audio file
      Throws:
      UnsupportedAudioFileException - if the file type is not a supported audio format
      IOException - if an I/O exception occurs
      LineUnavailableException - if a clip object is not available due to resource restrictions
      NullPointerException - if filepath is null

    • Sound

      public Sound(File file) throws UnsupportedAudioFileException, IOException, LineUnavailableException
      Loads a file for playing audio
      Parameters:
      file - the file to load
      Throws:
      UnsupportedAudioFileException - if the file type is not a supported audio format
      IOException - if an I/O exception occurs
      LineUnavailableException - if a clip object is not available due to resource restrictions
      NullPointerException - if file is null

  • Method Details

    • getVolume

      public float getVolume()
      Gets the current volume of the audio
      Returns:
      a value ranging from 0 to 1, 1 representing the maximum volume

    • setVolume

      public void setVolume(float volume)
      Sets the volume of the audio
      Parameters:
      volume - the volume between 0 and 1

    • play

      public void play()
      Starts playing the audo clip at time 0, does nothing if the sound is already playing

    • play

      public void play(long startTime)
      Starts playing the audio clip at a specified time
      Parameters:
      startTime - the time (in microseconds) to start playing from

    • pause

      public void pause()
      Pauses the audio clip, play can be resumed using resume()
      See Also:
      • resume()

    • resume

      public void resume()
      Resumes playing audio from the last saved position

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops playing audio and clears the last saved position

    • loop

      public void loop()

    • loop

      public void loop(int count)
      Loops the audio a specified number of times
      Parameters:
      count - the number of times to loop
